text: The Eastern Counties Railway (ECR) was an English railway company which began operating on 20 June 1839. It ran a train service from a temporary terminus at Mile End to Romford. This is now part of the Great Eastern Main Line. The line was extended the following year to a new London terminus at Shoreditch (later renamed Bishopsgate) and the line was subsequently extended to cover the 51 miles between London and Colchester. Category:Pre-grouping British railway companies Category:Rail transport in London Category:1839 establishments in Europe Category:1830s establishments in England Category:19th-century disestablishments in the United Kingdom Category:1860s disestablishments in Europe
title: Eastern Counties Railway
